com.justinkleiber.focus2d.base

Interface Graphics

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FocusGraphics

    public interface Graphics
    Provides an interface for drawing Graphics to the screen
    Author:
    Justin

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Graphics.ImageFormat
      Enum that lists the 3 possible ImageFormats

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float animatedXSpeed(int cx, int x, float pace)
      Lets the user animate an X coordinate in the draw functions
      float animatedYSpeed(int cy, int y, float pace)
      Lets the user animate a Y coordinate in the draw functions
      void animateSheetByIndex(SpriteSheet ss, int start, int end, int delay, boolean shouldStart, float angle)
      Animates a SpriteSheet from one index to another without regard for rows or columns.

      Animates a Static Rotation SpriteSheet column
      void animateSheetColumn(SpriteSheet ss, int x, int y, int col, int delay)
      Animates a Static Rotation SpriteSheet column with a delay The delay feature may have unexpected results because it is not integrated with the draw functions
      void animateSheetRow(SpriteSheet ss, float x, float y, int row, int delay, float angle)
      Animate a Dynamic Rotation SpriteSheet Row (origin point is at the center of Sprite for best rotation results) with a delay
      void animateSheetRow(SpriteSheet ss, float x, float y, int row, int delay, int delayIndex, float angle)
      Another way to animate a SpriteSheet row with a delay
      void animateSheetRow(SpriteSheet ss, int row, int delay)
      Animates a Static Rotation SpriteSheet row with a delay, assuming Position is defined
      void animateSheetRow(SpriteSheet ss, int row, int delay, float angle)
      Animate a Dynamic Rotation SpriteSheet Row (origin point is at the center of Sprite for best rotation results) with a delay This assumes Position is already defined
      void animateSheetRow(SpriteSheet ss, int x, int y, int row)
      Animates a Static Rotation SpriteSheet row

      Animates a Static Rotation SpriteSheet row with a delay The delay feature may have unexpected results because it is not integrated with the draw functions

      Draw a Dynamic Rotation Sprite (origin point is at the center for best rotation results), assuming Position is defined in the Sprite

      Draws a Static Rotation SpriteSheet, whose origin point is in the top left of the Sprite being drawn This function assumes that the position is defined

      • drawString

        void drawString(java.lang.String txt,
                int x,
                int y,
                Paint p)
        Draws a String to the screen
        Parameters:
        txt - The text to draw
        x - The x coordinate to draw the text at
        y - The y coordinate to draw the text at
        p - A Paint object that modifies the text appearance

        Clears the screen and displays one color
        Parameters:

              int y,
              int x2,
              int y2,
              int color)
        Draws a Line on the screen from a start point to an endpoint
        Parameters:
        x - Starting x coordinate
        y - Starting y coordinate
        x2 - Ending x coordinate
        y2 - Ending y coordinate
        color - Color of the line

              int y,
              int width,
              int height,
              int color)
        Draws a rectangle (not filled in)
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of top-left corner
        y - Y coordinate of top-left corner
        width - Width of the rectangle
        height - Height of the Rectangle
        color - Color of the Rectangle's lines

                int x,
                int y)
        Draws a Static Rotation Sprite, a Sprite whose origin point is at the top left corner
        Parameters:
        s - The Sprite to draw
        x - The x coordinate
        y - The y coordinate
        See Also:
        Sprite

      • drawSprite

        void drawSprite(Sprite s,
                Position p)
        Draws a Static Rotation Sprite, a Sprite whose origin point is at the top left corner
        Parameters:
        s - The Sprite to draw
        p - The Point where the Sprite's top-left corner should be
        See Also:
        Position, Sprite

      • drawSprite

        void drawSprite(Sprite s)
        Draws a Static Rotation Sprite, a Sprite whose origin point is at the top left corner. This function expects the Sprite to have its position defined already
        Parameters:
        s - The Sprite to draw
        See Also:
        Sprite

      • drawSpriteSheet

        void drawSpriteSheet(SpriteSheet ss,
                     int x,
                     int y,
                     int row,
                     int col)
        Draws a Static Rotation SpriteSheet, whose origin point is in the top left of the Sprite being drawn
        Parameters:
        ss - The SpriteSheet to reference
        x - X coordinate
        y - Y coordinate
        row - The index of the row that the Sprite being used is on
        col - The index of the column that the Sprite being used is on
        See Also:
        SpriteSheet

      • drawSpriteSheet

        void drawSpriteSheet(SpriteSheet ss,
                     int row,
                     int col)
        Draws a Static Rotation SpriteSheet, whose origin point is in the top left of the Sprite being drawn This function assumes that the position is defined
        Parameters:
        ssThe - SpriteSheet to reference
        row - The index of the row that the Sprite being used is on
        col - The index of the column that the Sprite being used is on
        See Also:
        SpriteSheet

      • animateSheetColumn

        void animateSheetColumn(SpriteSheet ss,
                        int x,
                        int y,
                        int col)
        Animates a Static Rotation SpriteSheet column
        Parameters:
        ss - The SpriteSheet to have animated
        x - The X coordinate
        y - The Y coordinate
        col - The column to animate
        See Also:
        SpriteSheet

      • animateSheetColumn

        void animateSheetColumn(SpriteSheet ss,
                        int x,
                        int y,
                        int col,
                        int delay)
        Animates a Static Rotation SpriteSheet column with a delay The delay feature may have unexpected results because it is not integrated with the draw functions
        Parameters:
        ss - The SpriteSheet to have animated
        x - The X coordinate
        y - The Y coordinate
        col - The column to animate
        delay - The amount of loops to wait between frames
        See Also:
        SpriteSheet

      • animateSheetRow

        void animateSheetRow(SpriteSheet ss,
                     int x,
                     int y,
                     int row,
                     int delay)
        Animates a Static Rotation SpriteSheet row with a delay The delay feature may have unexpected results because it is not integrated with the draw functions
        Parameters:
        ss - The SpriteSheet to have animated
        x - The X coordinate
        y - The Y coordinate
        row - The row to animate
        delay - The amount of loops to wait between frames
        See Also:
        SpriteSheet

      • animateSheetRow

        void animateSheetRow(SpriteSheet ss,
                     int row,
                     int delay)
        Animates a Static Rotation SpriteSheet row with a delay, assuming Position is defined
        Parameters:
        ss - The SpriteSheet to animate
        row - The row to animate
        delay - The amount of loops to wait between frames
        See Also:
        SpriteSheet

      • animateSpriteToPosition

        void animateSpriteToPosition(Sprite s,
                             Position p,
                             int pace)
        Animates a Sprite to a position on the screen
        Parameters:
        s - The Sprite
        p - The position the Sprite should go
        pace - How quickly the Sprite should go there (Proportional Control)

      • animateSpriteSheetToPosition

        void animateSpriteSheetToPosition(SpriteSheet s,
                                  int row,
                                  int col,
                                  Position p,
                                  float pace)
        Animates a SpriteSheet Sprite to a position on the screen
        Parameters:
        s - The SpriteSheet
        row - The row of the Sprite
        col - The column of the Sprite
        p - The position the Sprite should go
        pace - How quickly the Sprite should go there (Proportional Control)

      • drawSprite

        void drawSprite(Sprite s,
                Position p,
                float angle)
        Draw a Dynamic Rotation Sprite (origin point is at the center for best rotation results)
        Parameters:
        s - Sprite to draw
        p - Position to draw the Sprite
        angle - Angle to rotate the Sprite

      • drawSprite

        void drawSprite(Sprite s,
                float angle)
        Draw a Dynamic Rotation Sprite (origin point is at the center for best rotation results), assuming Position is defined in the Sprite
        Parameters:
        s - Sprite to draw
        angle - Angle to rotate the Sprite

      • drawSprite

        void drawSprite(Sprite s,
                int x,
                int y,
                float angle)
        Draw a Dynamic Rotation Sprite (origin point is at the center for best rotation results)
        Parameters:
        s - Sprite to draw
        x - X coordinate
        y - Y coordinate
        angle - Angle to rotate the Sprite

      • animateSheetRow

        void animateSheetRow(SpriteSheet ss,
                     int row,
                     int delay,
                     float angle)
        Animate a Dynamic Rotation SpriteSheet Row (origin point is at the center of Sprite for best rotation results) with a delay This assumes Position is already defined
        Parameters:
        ss - SpriteSheet to animate
        row - Row to animate
        delay - amount of loops to wait before progressing to next frame
        angle - Angle of rotation

      • animateSheetRow

        void animateSheetRow(SpriteSheet ss,
                     float x,
                     float y,
                     int row,
                     int delay,
                     float angle)
        Animate a Dynamic Rotation SpriteSheet Row (origin point is at the center of Sprite for best rotation results) with a delay
        Parameters:
        ss - SpriteSheet to animate
        x - X coordinate
        y - Y coordinate
        row - Row to animate
        delay - amount of loops to wait before progressing to next frame
        angle - Angle of rotation

      • animateSheetRow

        void animateSheetRow(SpriteSheet ss,
                     float x,
                     float y,
                     int row,
                     int delay,
                     int delayIndex,
                     float angle)
        Another way to animate a SpriteSheet row with a delay
        Parameters:
        ss - SpriteSheet
        x - X coordinate
        y - Y coordinate
        row - Row to animate
        delay - the amount of frames to wait
        delayIndex - the index to store the certain delay amount in
        angle - Rotation angle

      • animateSheetByIndex

        void animateSheetByIndex(SpriteSheet ss,
                         int start,
                         int end,
                         int delay,
                         boolean shouldStart,
                         float angle)
        Animates a SpriteSheet from one index to another without regard for rows or columns. Index 0 is the top left of the SpriteSheet and increments to the right. New lines do not affect index
        Parameters:
        ss - SpriteSheet
        start - The index to start at
        end - The index to end at
        delay - The amount of loops to wait between frames
        shouldStart - Restarts the sequence if true
        angle - Angle of Rotation

      • animateSpriteSheetToCoordinates

        void animateSpriteSheetToCoordinates(SpriteSheet s,
                                     int row,
                                     int col,
                                     int cx,
                                     int cy,
                                     int x,
                                     int y,
                                     float pace,
                                     float angle)
        Animates a Dynamic Rotation SpriteSheet to a point
        Parameters:
        s - SpriteSheet
        row - the row of the Sprite
        col - The column of the Sprite
        cx - The current X coord
        cy - The current Y coord
        x - The desired x coord
        y - The desired y coord
        pace - The speed (Proportional Control)
        angle - Rotation angle

      • animatedXSpeed

        float animatedXSpeed(int cx,
                     int x,
                     float pace)
        Lets the user animate an X coordinate in the draw functions
        Parameters:
        cx - Current x coord
        x - Desired x coord
        pace - The speed (Proportional Control)
        Returns:
        The new X coordinate

      • animatedYSpeed

        float animatedYSpeed(int cy,
                     int y,
                     float pace)
        Lets the user animate a Y coordinate in the draw functions
        Parameters:
        cy - Current y coord
        y - Desired y coord
        pace - The speed (Proportional Control)
        Returns:
        The new Y coordinate

      • drawHitBox

        void drawHitBox(int x,
                int y,
                int w,
                int h,
                int tx,
                int ty,
                int tw,
                int th,
                float angle,
                Paint paint)
        Draws the Dynamic Rotation hitbox around an object
        Parameters:
        x - x coord
        y - y coord
        w - width
        h - height
        tx - Not used anymore
        ty - Not used anymore
        tw - Not used anymore
        th - Not used anymore
        angle - rotation angle
        paint - Color and style of line
